intro: Metrosideros waialealae var. waialealae, commonly known as the Akala or Hawaiian Christmas Bush, is a unique species native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a small, evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in wet, coastal habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its flowers are particularly attractive to native Hawaiian birds, which play a key role in its pollination. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, this plant is considered endangered and is protected under Hawaiian conservation laws.
